subject: Avoid empty values in 'mounts' options
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-10 19:33:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Avoid empty values in 'mounts' options

Change-Id: Ic073098c8cd30bbf7e477c22bbdc59cb6f6bd18f
Closes-Bug: #1747282
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-10 20:18:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid empty values in 'mounts' options

The python-zunclient sends the 'mounts' parameter to server
in one of the following forms:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'size': ''}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'source': ''}

This patch changes it to:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx}

The new form doesn't contain a key with empty string value.
This allows a better validation on the server side in the
future.

Change-Id: Ic073098c8cd30bbf7e477c22bbdc59cb6f6bd18f
Closes-Bug: #1747282
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-03-05 03:32:35.000000000', 'files': ['zunclient/common/utils.py', 'zunclient/tests/unit/v1/test_containers_shell.py'], 'message': "Avoid empty values in 'mounts' options

The python-zunclient sends the 'mounts' parameter to server
in one of the following forms:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'size': ''}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx, 'source': ''}

This patch changes it to:
1. {'source': xxx, 'destination': xxx}
2. {'size': xxx, 'destination': xxx}

The new form doesn't contain a key with empty string value.
This allows a better validation on the server side in the
future.

Change-Id: Ic073098c8cd30bbf7e477c22bbdc59cb6f6bd18f
Closes-Bug: #1747282
", 'number': 3}]

commit_message:
Fix conflicted Request class name

This patch changes the class and module name
from swift.common.middleware.s3api.request.Request
to swift.common.middleware.s3api.s3request.S3Request

And then, fix some broken issues related to the module name and path
change.

Change-Id: I00adc53e2f0f01b712c57b4572ed3ec51877fe49

commit_message:
Neutron: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

Change-Id: Ifcbc19b17aa1d145f12ed1aed8b15a69ca045bb7

commit_message:
Remove duplicate configuration options on trove templates

The option neutron_endpoint_type is duplicate on these files:
 - trove/templates/trove.conf.j2
 - trove/templates/trove-taskmanager.conf.j2

We just have to remove one occurrence.

Change-Id: If5c91cf7b491966b1deac42c694af5995df9b11e

commit_message:
Add ff-upg to featureset table

This is being submitted as a separate patch so that we don't risk the
actual important FFU patch colliding with any other featureset table
change. This table-only patch is small and should be easy to rebase
and we don't mind delaying it a bit due to conflicts.

Change-Id: Iab0bdc8472a0f83a262b6e7cc1a7e2b31d517c6a

commit_message:
Force generation of Karaf logs to avoid POST_FAILUREs

Whenever the Karaf log is not generated, the CI job fails with a
POST_FAILURE error because the log is missing upon collection. This
usually happens when devstack fails to start.

This patch generates an empty file before Karaf is run. This way if
there is a failure and the log is not generated the job wouldn't fail.

Change-Id: Ibb84940a380c6b5c8ea9bc01c4c39bcd5b48db19

commit_message:
Create base server listening on sbus

This patch introduces basic implementation of the server processes
to execute operations corresponding to the request on sbus
procotol, which is a common base for agents running in docker
container.

NOTE:
This patch also fixes broken unit tests about storlet_daemon

Change-Id: I4c45861e6946a518afa6cf0f96e99e3d177259d9

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I9ea7e69986056f1172e834e01d9e3dcbcaa3a22b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Update tox.ini and requirements.txt for proper setup.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 22:19:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix missing parentid on rule delete journal record

This fixes an error raised when deleting a security group if there are
pending rules to be deleted of that group as records in the journal
that were not triggered by the group deletion operation itself so that
they did not have the parent security group id as data of the record.

This happens when the rule and the group are deleted independently but
in rapid succession. It does not happen when the rules are deleted as a
consequence of deleting the group since the parentid is correctly set
in that case, neither when the group is deleted some time after the
rules when their records might have already been processed and removed.

This problem was encountered in OPNFV functest environment but may also
fix https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/NETVIRT-896 and complement
change #533706.

Change-Id: I5ccdbdea9d803334c8ae9416b40e3c4b48a8144b
Closes-Bug: 1744966
Signed-off-by: Jaime Caamaño Ruiz <jcaamano@suse.com>

commit_message:
Fix missing parentid on rule delete journal record

This fixes an error raised when deleting a security group if there are
pending rules to be deleted of that group as records in the journal
that were not triggered by the group deletion operation itself so that
they did not have the parent security group id as data of the record.

This happens when the rule and the group are deleted independently but
in rapid succession. It does not happen when the rules are deleted as a
consequence of deleting the group since the parentid is correctly set
in that case, neither when the group is deleted some time after the
rules when their records might have already been processed and removed.

This problem was encountered in OPNFV functest environment but may also
fix [1] and complement [2].

[1] https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/NETVIRT-896
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536935

Change-Id: I5ccdbdea9d803334c8ae9416b40e3c4b48a8144b
Closes-Bug: 1744966
Signed-off-by: Jaime Caamaño Ruiz <jcaamano@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2c15a7926dfd24ee363a15c53ac44dedfae7e0ce)

commit_message:
Update default ETCD_VERSION to latest 3.2 etcd release

This updates the default ETCD_VERSION to the latest 3.2 etcd release,
v3.2.17.  3.2 is chosen as it is packaged in bionic and fedora; we
hope to move to packaged versions for distros that support it in due
course.

This version supports arm64 and ppc64le which were not supported by the
previous default, v3.1.10.

We have removed the override to tarballs.o.o, as these files are now
cached as described in [1]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-March/005871.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556688
Change-Id: I5103b4331a8d7c5660848fc148ebe4139ce6dad9

commit_message:
Don't raise when delete non-existent image in docker

When delete an image, we check whether 404 is in the exception.
If the image doesn't exist in docker, we can continue to delete
the image in DB.

Change-Id: Ic500fbec9159059d89fde879bc4b0aa7389e8abe

[{'created': '2016-05-09 07:20:20.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "generate latest sample config file along with document

Currently, when users want to get the sample config file, they
need to install many development tools such as git, tox and etc,
then run `tox -egenconfig` to get it.

oslo_config provides a tool named sphinxconfiggen since version
2.3.0, which enables us generate the sample config file along with
document.

Let's use it, so users can directly download it from our document
site.

Change-Id: Ic2eedfcd26b43ef77b042ac986be61274276063b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
generate latest sample config file along with document

Currently, when users want to get the sample config file, they
need to install many development tools such as git, tox and etc,
then run `tox -egenconfig` to get it.

oslo_config provides a tool named sphinxconfiggen since version
2.3.0, which enables us generate the sample config file along with
document.

Let's use it, so users can directly download it from our document
site.

Change-Id: Ic2eedfcd26b43ef77b042ac986be61274276063b

commit_message:
Reduce runtime for l7rule too_many_rules test

Running 50 times (our max limit for l7 rules) takes a really long time.
If we mock the limit to something more reasonable, it will still
validate that we limit correctly.

Change-Id: Id95c84f2a6f552714f1af955cf027e7f50d90ab0

commit_message:
Remove cinder v1 service and endpoints

The cinder v1 API was removed in the queens release. The
'os_keystone_service' module is used to allow removal of existing
services and endpoints. Disabling the v2 API will now also ensure there
is not a registered service or endpoints.

The 'cinder_enable_v3_api' variable has been removed since it had no
effect on cinder's enablement of the v3 API.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557016/
Change-Id: I02d2bae8712c0ca223cafb5a43304806c4b83125

commit_message:
Fix neutron with extensions job

* Extend neutron-with-extensions job with a proper required_projects
  section. It allows to launch all neutron extensions which we have
  in legacy job (except openstack/neutron-fwaas which has
  broken/uncompatible devstack plugin)
* Move load-balancing checks to the separate job

Change-Id: Iafa8950c3140987af7141a156e972eee1379f5d9

subject: add a validation rule to prevent pre-releases after finals
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 17:45:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py', 'openstack_releases/deliverable.py'], 'message': 'add a validation rule to prevent pre-releases after finals

Add a validation rule to prevent someone from tagging a release using
a pre-release version (alpha, beta, rc) in a series after a final has
been tagged for that series.

Change-Id: Ia0c84d37bec43725d93b0c7daea0a68bace6407d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
add a validation rule to prevent pre-releases after finals

Add a validation rule to prevent someone from tagging a release using
a pre-release version (alpha, beta, rc) in a series after a final has
been tagged for that series.

Change-Id: Ia0c84d37bec43725d93b0c7daea0a68bace6407d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from job definition

Given that the parent is the functional job, which already
includes all the required roles, this is unnecessary and
only serves to slow down the test.

Change-Id: Iadcebc9eca9e279ea647a7a35bff5d00f82489f1
(cherry picked from commit 1416166a705f4f3eed9547aa86a899a777aec134)

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from job definition

Given that the parent is the functional job, which already
includes all the required roles, this is unnecessary and
only serves to slow down the test.

Change-Id: Iadcebc9eca9e279ea647a7a35bff5d00f82489f1
(cherry picked from commit 1416166a705f4f3eed9547aa86a899a777aec134)

commit_message:
Reduce stestr concurrency to 1 for tempest jobs

The switch from testr to stestr introduced in Change-Id
Icf1f9eb4539666dffb6c9c1651670541523a9f9e missed setting concurrency
jobs to 1 for api and scenario tests, leading to intermittent gate
issues.

This patch also fixes coverage test that got broken in the
aforementioned Change-Id.

Change-Id: I052a9c3b376624f8e9e63faa98f4d09a93bdde4d
(cherry picked from commit f27c44c478ba5602f91eea0aa37b5fea8b941015)

commit_message:
Ensure doc8 is run

When a doc8 issue has been detected, the CI job must fail.

Change-Id: Ic4a5867b5c38643231f5af97acb4d66878a2ae4d

commit_message:
DNM: tentative hack to point to neutron-lib master

This is a hack to allow testing changes stacked on this one
with neutron-lib change Id5aea04553b78dd17fca85de88cf076b42d24140.

The Depends-On magic does not work when neutron-lib is not
declared in zuul job 'required-projects' attribute.

Change-Id: Icec21d35ba2bfe00737380a543bd50fa72a8dd5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 07:37:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use virt_type in /os-hypervisors/details API

Microversion 2.59 responses virt_type instead of hypervisor_type in
GET /os-hypervisors/details API if hypervisor_type is 'QEMU'.

If libvirt virt_type is kvm or qemu, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is
'QEMU', no matter whether KVM or QEMU is used for libvirt backend.
This is because both KVM and QEMU guests are serviced by the driver
for the qemu:// URI in libvirt.

For this reason, this patch changes /os-hypervisors/details API to
return virt_type, which is passed by operator to each compute node
via nova.conf if hypervisor_type is QEMU.

Closes-Bug: #1195361
Change-Id: Iad94cfb499f972d51c2ab1d00d91ec32249f1cee
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-05 09:50:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix hypervisor_type in /os-hypervisors/details

In GET /os-hypervisors/details API, microversion 2.59 makes a response
for hypervisor_type value from ComputeNode.supported_hv_specs object
instead of retrieving it from ComputeNode.hypervisor_type in GET
/os-hypervisors/details API if the actual backend is KVM or QEMU.

If libvirt virt_type is kvm or qemu, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is
'QEMU', no matter whether KVM or QEMU is used for the actual backend.
This is because both KVM and QEMU guests are serviced by the driver
for the qemu:// URI in libvirt and libvirt's getType() API, via which
Nova gets the value, returns QEMU in both cases.

We are not going to change this value directly because this is used
for version checking in nova's libvirt driver, and that, actually,
it is hypervisor_type from supported_hv_specs, which we are now using
in scheduler filters such as ImagePropertiesFilter, and that really
matters for operators and end-users.

For this reason, this patch changes /os-hypervisors/details API to
retrieve the hypervisor_type value from supported_hv_specs, which
is guaranteed to have the same value with virt_type, if
Computenode.hypervisor_type returns 'QEMU' value.

Closes-Bug: #1195361
Change-Id: Iad94cfb499f972d51c2ab1d00d91ec32249f1cee
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-01-06 01:58:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix hypervisor_type in /os-hypervisors/details

If libvirt virt_type is kvm or qemu, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is
'QEMU', no matter whether KVM or QEMU is used for the actual backend.
This is because both KVM and QEMU guests are serviced by the driver
for the qemu:// URI in libvirt and libvirt's getType() API, via which
Nova gets the value, returns QEMU in both cases.

We are not going to change this value directly because this is used

For this reason, this patch changes /os-hypervisors/details API to

Closes-Bug: #1195361
Change-Id: Iad94cfb499f972d51c2ab1d00d91ec32249f1cee
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2018-01-30 11:48:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix hypervisor_type in /os-hypervisors/details

In GET /os-hypervisors/details API, microversion 2.61 makes a response
for hypervisor_type value from ComputeNode.supported_hv_specs object
instead of retrieving it from ComputeNode.hypervisor_type in GET
/os-hypervisors/details API if the actual backend is KVM or QEMU.

If libvirt virt_type is kvm or qemu, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is
'QEMU', no matter whether KVM or QEMU is used for the actual backend.
This is because both KVM and QEMU guests are serviced by the driver
for the qemu:// URI in libvirt and libvirt's getType() API, via which
Nova gets the value, returns QEMU in both cases.

We are not going to change this value directly because this is used
for version checking in nova's libvirt driver, and that, actually,
it is hypervisor_type from supported_hv_specs, which we are now using
in scheduler filters such as ImagePropertiesFilter, and that really
matters for operators and end-users.

For this reason, this patch changes /os-hypervisors/details API to
retrieve the hypervisor_type value from supported_hv_specs, which
is guaranteed to have the same value with virt_type, if

commit_message:
Fix hypervisor_type in /os-hypervisors/details

In GET /os-hypervisors/details API, microversion 2.61 makes a response
for hypervisor_type value from ComputeNode.supported_hv_specs object
instead of retrieving it from ComputeNode.hypervisor_type in GET
/os-hypervisors/details API if the actual backend is KVM or QEMU.

If libvirt virt_type is kvm or qemu, ComputeNode.hypervisor_type is
'QEMU', no matter whether KVM or QEMU is used for the actual backend.
This is because both KVM and QEMU guests are serviced by the driver
for the qemu:// URI in libvirt and libvirt's getType() API, via which
Nova gets the value, returns QEMU in both cases.

We are not going to change this value directly because this is used
for version checking in nova's libvirt driver, and that, actually,
it is hypervisor_type from supported_hv_specs, which we are now using
in scheduler filters such as ImagePropertiesFilter, and that really
matters for operators and end-users.

For this reason, this patch changes /os-hypervisors/details API to
retrieve the hypervisor_type value from supported_hv_specs, which
is guaranteed to have the same value with virt_type, if
Computenode.hypervisor_type returns 'QEMU' value.

Closes-Bug: #1195361
Blueprint: support-kvm-hypervisor-api
Change-Id: Iad94cfb499f972d51c2ab1d00d91ec32249f1cee

commit_message:
Report KVM hypervisor_type in hypervisor API

If libvirt's `virt_type` is set to `kvm` or `qemu`,
`GET /os-hypervisors/details` returns `QEMU` for the
`hypervisor_type` regardless of whether the backend is
KVM accelerated or not.

This spec changes it to return `KVM` if KVM acceleration
is used on that host.

Change-Id: I308ac36f12c9d7de673073b57d1a4e3eb4829e87
Blueprint: support-kvm-hypervisor-api

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib03b8b7870ff810d60d848e09989448fb539ab99
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
XenAPI: use dom0's hostname for nova-compute

When the virt dirver is xenapi, we should explicitly specify host
with dom0's hostname for nova-compute. The host field should be same
as neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.

In order to use dom0's hostname, we need pull the bootstrap_xenapi
to before running nova config tasks. The dom0's hostname will be
included in the XenAPI facts.

Change-Id: Ibfc964bbd6c569062ad33c1399f9a4612baf5b92
blueprint: xenserver-support

commit_message:
Remove admin interface in sample Apache file

We provide a sample Apache file for mod_wsgi that references the admin
port 35357. This is consumed by distributors such as RDO[1]. To bring
consumers of this example file in line with the other distributors,
this patch removes the vhost for the admin port from the example.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/gitweb?p=openstack/keystone-distgit.git;a=blob;f=openstack-keystone.spec;h=b59c2a7c1ca546d205dafe278e035da5ee829728;hb=refs/heads/queens-rdo#l209

Change-Id: I86b5a43beb18e730c2b18a36316d51751e6c1696

commit_message:
project: Split quota update into a separate workflow

This commit converts the quota update workflow tab into
a separate workflow. After this change, admin cannot set
a project's quotas in the project creation workflow,
but the admin can update its quotas just after creating a project,
so I think it is not a problem.

Because of splitting quota update from a project create/update workflow,
our unit tests has been simplified significantly. Previously we needed
tests for **combination** of create/update project and quota update,
but we now need only tests for create/update project and quota update
separately.

Part of blueprint horizon-plugin-tab-for-info-and-quotas
Change-Id: I7b95428e89ddc1c7a85a1162db29cef9a9674129

commit_message:
Add cpu_mode into deployment-philosophy.rst

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

commit_message:
Switch to tempest run cli for running tempest tests

* https://review.openstack.org/504345 moves the tempest run cli

  running blacklist and whitelist tests together.

commit_message:
Remove 'executable' arg from command task

Eliminates the following warning:

[WARNING]: As of Ansible 2.4, the parameter 'executable' is no longer
supported with the 'command' module. Not using '/bin/bash'.

Change-Id: Ie540ad28eec47b615ed6e1a36b25959eb6cd21c2
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: [Urgent] correct remap logic
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 16:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Urgent] correct remap logic

The previous implementation uses "replace" to map the
model field to display column, which will incorrectly
map "project id" to "project ID" since (id -> ID) is
also in the mapping. This patch changes to use exact
match of string so "project id" can be correctly map
to "Project".

Change-Id: I29980a834bc74fea74399c3ee15a25942e771016
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-02 01:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['tricircleclient/utils.py'], 'message': '[Urgent] correct remap logic

The previous implementation uses "replace" to map the
model field to display column, which will incorrectly
map "project id" to "project ID" since (id -> ID) is
also in the mapping. This patch sorts the mapping by
the length of key to do a longest match so "project id"
will be replaced as "Project" first.

Change-Id: I29980a834bc74fea74399c3ee15a25942e771016
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[Urgent] correct remap logic

The previous implementation uses "replace" to map the
model field to display column, which will incorrectly
map "project id" to "project ID" since (id -> ID) is
also in the mapping. This patch sorts the mapping by
the length of key to do a longest match so "project id"
will be replaced as "Project" first.

Change-Id: I29980a834bc74fea74399c3ee15a25942e771016

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-26 02:10:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by using != operator to compare two dicts.
So is assertEqual() in testtools.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we just call assertEqual() to make the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I5035de8cc922e20a623b0aafdfba7da3263db0a6
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2016-07-26 07:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_cmode.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/test_lib_base.py', 'manila/tests/api/views/test_scheduler_stats.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/test_lib_multi_svm.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts.
So is assertEqual() in testtools.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle
dict, list, set and so on. So we just call

Change-Id: I5035de8cc922e20a623b0aafdfba7da3263db0a6

commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts.
So is assertEqual() in testtools.
assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle
dict, list, set and so on. So we just call
assertEqual() to make the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I5035de8cc922e20a623b0aafdfba7da3263db0a6

commit_message:
Error path of WSGIScriptAlias of panko for ubuntu

/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/panko/api/app.wsgi.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/02/504302/4/check/puppet-openstack-beaker-xenial/aeb24d6/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-28_00_39_06_878490

commit_message:
Add option to specify the timeout for reproducer script

Current default timeout for jobs running in CI is 180
minutes which is not sufficient for some of the scenarios
to complete. This patch set's default timeout for reproducer
script to 240 minutes which should be sufficient for most
of the scenarios and add an option -t|--timeout to override
this default.

Change-Id: Iad864e2edb03d66b09d612178c2fbec0d4501fc1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 16:13:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Stable keepalived priorities

The calculation of the keepalived priority depended on the set of hosts
in the ansible_play_hosts variable. This meant that priorites changed
when the playbook was limited to only run on a subset of the hosts in
the "haproxy" group (eg. when reinstalling just one node).

This change replaces ansible_play_hosts by groups["haproxy"] so that the
priority calculation is stable as long as the set of haproxy nodes does
not change. It also simplifies the priority calculation without
changeing the result.

This change does not change the configuration in case the playbook is
run without --limit and ensures that the configuration does not change
if it is run with --limit.

Change-Id: I378351954fbed7b1fc31303c60e4575ddad9cf1d
(cherry picked from commit 78ed74957dfbd1bb151d0e6b5187fa0c263881ad)

commit_message:
Stable keepalived priorities

The calculation of the keepalived priority depended on the set of hosts
in the ansible_play_hosts variable. This meant that priorites changed
when the playbook was limited to only run on a subset of the hosts in
the "haproxy" group (eg. when reinstalling just one node).

This change replaces ansible_play_hosts by groups["haproxy"] so that the
priority calculation is stable as long as the set of haproxy nodes does
not change. It also simplifies the priority calculation without
changeing the result.

This change does not change the configuration in case the playbook is
run without --limit and ensures that the configuration does not change
if it is run with --limit.

To make sure the group vars resolution is not done in a all group,
which might have 0 haproxy nodes, we ensure the group vars are applied
properly to the haproxy group. This is a partial backport of the
patch to limit group_vars scoping [1].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/85501cbf263029cfd5be44b9274113e4e5e4b6f8#diff-849f58a4930e8d8f73fd8310002552a9

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Change-Id: I378351954fbed7b1fc31303c60e4575ddad9cf1d
(cherry picked from commit 78ed74957dfbd1bb151d0e6b5187fa0c263881ad)

commit_message:
Rename python-openstacksdk to openstacksdk

The git repo is being renamed today, so we should update this doc
string. Also, correct the description. SDK is a single library, not a
collection of libraries.

Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Change-Id: I157d3d4ce52b22e5a3f675bccb6d540e1fd2abb1

commit_message:
Set volume catalog type to volumev3

The cinder v1 API was removed in the queens release. The default
registered catalog type for the latest supported API is volumev3 and
should be used when performing tests against cinder.

Change-Id: Ia181d44ae6c307e5529fce763f700b51990ca5fa

subject: Use addCleanup to detach volume instead of explicit detach
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 09:37:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use addCleanup to detach volume instead of explicit detach

Cinder volume delete [1] is executed during resource cleanup.
So, if test fails due to some reason then it tries to delete a volume
which is "in-use" state. Detach volume should be executed before

commit_message:
Use addCleanup to detach volume instead of explicit detach

Cinder volume delete [1] is executed during resource cleanup.
So, if test fails due to some reason then it tries to delete a volume
which is "in-use" state. Detach volume should be executed before
trying to delete the volume. This patch adds nova_detach volume
as a cleanup task.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/a6d945d8e677dedf73ccb7b2f7271e8fc96836be/barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py#L229

Change-Id: I3457bb6fc22a7bb6a32c8d6f4ea5879aeb8d43c5
Related-Bug: #1755485

commit_message:
Enable hacking-extensions H204, H205

This patch enable extensions:
- H204: Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality.
- H205: Use assert(Greater|Less)(Equal) for comparison.

Change-Id: Ice22442e4212784acd01dec045ecc438611155b7

commit_message:
Change memcache_socket_timeout to a float

It's not unusual to set 0.25 as a socket_timeout value, and this was
not possible. This can have a dramatic impact for performance when one
memcached server is down, especially when keystone is involved.

Change-Id: I01356b7873ad78cb38779f5c5ddd2b932889c911
Partial-Bug: #1731921

commit_message:
Removing deprecated function 'IPWrapper.get_namespaces()'

'IPWrapper.get_namespaces()' is deprecated in version 'Queens'
and was marked to be removed 'Rocky'.
This patch removes it and switches to use
'neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib.list_network_namespaces' instead.

Change-Id: I3af91c67e55279f4503499ade49ed0d02c57b9b5

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5352398603e5755d46c9c033b05af637e379eea0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop running get-ansible-role-requirements with -vvv

It generates a lot of console spam and adds very little value to
clone the roles with verbose every time.

Change-Id: If66a4d09dda8bab477c8f8aa8d5cefee7db7ddd9

subject: Clean imports in code
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 05:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/redirect.py'], 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I7766149b0b74b745f73cd26f6f2352042b0ab570
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I7766149b0b74b745f73cd26f6f2352042b0ab570

commit_message:
make the --reqs arg to project-requirements-change.py useful

The --reqs argument was not being used which made it difficult to run
the script locally to test it.

This change passes the directory given to --reqs as the requirements
repository directory so that in local mode the repository can live
anywhere.

The default is still set to the location used on the CI nodes.

Change-Id: Id812628345313b781d65140bb3c25adf1eb00bc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 09:54:34.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/kubernetes/kube/base.py', 'contrib/kubernetes/kube/worker.py'], 'message': "Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error

kubernetes auth use 'user' and 'project' create context,
but the parameter was modify 'user_id' and 'project_id'.
So, the database get data auth faild.

Change-Id: I366aee582ece6291494b04329f2f14e4491edc0a
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Kubernetes: Fix cluster database get return error

kubernetes auth use 'user' and 'project' create context,
but the parameter was modify 'user_id' and 'project_id'.
So, the database get data auth faild.

Change-Id: I366aee582ece6291494b04329f2f14e4491edc0a
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I72fd5f8c87133713cd272de210b7e957880f48f9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Consolidate admin guide and configuration guide

Both admin guide and configuration guide are targeting for the
same group of readers. There is no need to separate these two guides.
Move all contents under doc/source/admin to doc/source/configuration

subject: use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 22:29:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85 and will be
consumed in neutron via I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's multiprovidernet
API definition rather than neutron's extension.

commit_message:
use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85 and will be
consumed in neutron via I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's multiprovidernet
API definition rather than neutron's extension.

Change-Id: I17350e143beb8ff1cc4ea80b48caa9f9b080cdb3

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: I51d6a2172b3d2cce8b20591e77f62b75ee336b39
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
install-guide: add steps to configure rootwrap

We need to configure rootwrap to start privsep daemon that is
used to execute privilege commands. Otherwise, all the shell
commands are not going to work.

Related-Bug: #1749342

subject: Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 21:57:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix testtools.testcase.attr interaction with rbac decorator

This is to fix the testtools.testcase.attr interaction between
the RBAC rule validation decorator. More specifically, the
@decorators.idempotent_id decorator from tempest.lib is conflicting
with the RBAC test role attribute that is injected as well
during a call to rbac_rule_validation.action decorator. This
conflict occurs when the rbac_rule_validation.action decorator
is above the decorators.idempotent_id decorator -- in this case
the idempotent ID is lost and replaced by the RBAC test role
(if the order is switched both attributes are printed out).

This fixes this issue so that, no matter the order, both attributes
are printed out. This is accomplished via functools.wraps [0].

Also cleans up some decorator code in rbac_rule_validation by
using @decorators.attr(type=role) which is cleaner than the
present implementation.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps

Change-Id: I8fde00e4f9332ba9b9ea94edc714d87ab9e1b851
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-20 23:47:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix testtools.testcase.attr interaction with rbac decorator

This is to fix the testtools.testcase.attr interaction between
the RBAC rule validation decorator. More specifically, the
@decorators.idempotent_id decorator from tempest.lib is conflicting
with the RBAC test role attribute that is injected as well
during a call to rbac_rule_validation.action decorator. This
conflict occurs when the rbac_rule_validation.action decorator
is above the decorators.idempotent_id decorator -- in this case
the idempotent ID is lost and replaced by the RBAC test role
(if the order is switched both attributes are printed out).

This fixes this issue so that, no matter the order, both attributes
are printed out. This is accomplished via functools.wraps [0].

Also cleans up some decorator code in rbac_rule_validation by
using @decorators.attr(type=role) which is cleaner than the
present implementation.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps

Change-Id: I8fde00e4f9332ba9b9ea94edc714d87ab9e1b851
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-03-22 18:49:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation

This adds functools.wraps [0] to rbac_rule_validation decorator.
"This takes a function used in a decorator and adds the functionality
of copying over the function name, docstring, arguments list, etc." which
is quite convenient [1].

commit_message:
Add functools.wraps decorator to rbac_rule_validation

This adds functools.wraps [0] to rbac_rule_validation decorator.
"This takes a function used in a decorator and adds the functionality
of copying over the function name, docstring, arguments list, etc." which
is quite convenient [1].

Also stops adding the role as a testcase attribute which can cause
filtering issues via regular expressions when the role doesn't match
the role in tempest.conf under ``[patrole].rbac_test_role``.

[0] https://docs.python.org/2/library/functools.html#functools.wraps
[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/308999/what-does-functools-wraps-do

Change-Id: I8fde00e4f9332ba9b9ea94edc714d87ab9e1b851

commit_message:
add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674

commit_message:
Fix nova profile get old image attribute

When nova profile execute update_image operation, the
old_image use profile image attribute.

However, the image of nova server does not guarantee that
it has not been modified by other components. So, the
old_image it should be the image attribute contained in server.

Change-Id: If68c54e67fccb3ec186831aa578f45a11007357d
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Non-unique network names in Servers IPs API response

Report correct server IP information when multiple networks
with the same name are used in VM. This spec proposes to
group VM networks using their IDs rater than names in
Server IPs API resource.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint servers-ips-non-unique-network-names

Partial-Bug: #1708316
Change-Id: I1b13ed3bfc647b1b85e1535bc17c06bde0fe0d24
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

It is possible to assign a serial number to virtual hard disks which
can be queried by the guest operating system. We currently do this for
attached volumes, but we don't do it for local disks: local root
disks, ephemerals, or swap disks.

commit_message:
Add serial numbers for local disks

It is possible to assign a serial number to virtual hard disks which
can be queried by the guest operating system. We currently do this for
attached volumes, but we don't do it for local disks: local root
disks, ephemerals, or swap disks.

Previously-approved: Queens
Blueprint: local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I6f11e0344db78b9bd9e7406dfd07ab2e3f06eddf

commit_message:
Don't inform root about FOUND shard ranges

There is no need to tell the root container about shard ranges that
have been newly found. The root is not interested in ranges until
their shard containers have been created.

subject: Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 15:53:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable

Change-Id: Ib74e2efc4e854a2dd95101777bca114a7865fba7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-26 13:30:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable

Before, ContainerBroker.find_shard_ranges assumed that any existing
shard ranges had same size as the shard_size passed to the current
invocation of the method when estimating progress.  This could lead to
undesirable results if different shard sizes were used for different
invocation, particularly if the shard size increased to make the
progress appear larger than reality.

With this patch the estimate of progress is based on the actual sizes
of previously found shard ranges. For this to be accurate, previously
found ranges must have remained in FOUND state i.e. no shard container
has yet been created and no newer object updates made to the
shards. If this is not true then the progress estimate is considered
unreliable and defaults to zero.

A TODO is removed which suggested that the object_count might be
refreshed before processing each found range upper. This does not seem
necessary because find_shard_ranges() is called after container has
moved to SHARDING state such that the db being scanned is effectively
'read-only'.

Change-Id: Ib74e2efc4e854a2dd95101777bca114a7865fba7
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Only use estimated progress in find_shard_ranges if reliable

Before, ContainerBroker.find_shard_ranges assumed that any existing
shard ranges had same size as the shard_size passed to the current
invocation of the method when estimating progress.  This could lead to
undesirable results if different shard sizes were used for different
invocation, particularly if the shard size increased to make the
progress appear larger than reality.

With this patch the estimate of progress is based on the actual sizes
of previously found shard ranges. For this to be accurate, previously
found ranges must have remained in FOUND state i.e. no shard container
has yet been created and no newer object updates made to the
shards. If this is not true then the progress estimate is considered
unreliable and defaults to zero.

A TODO is removed which suggested that the object_count might be
refreshed before processing each found range upper. This does not seem
necessary because find_shard_ranges() is called after container has
moved to SHARDING state such that the db being scanned is effectively
'read-only'.

Change-Id: Ib74e2efc4e854a2dd95101777bca114a7865fba7

Move toward a consistent interface to the methods that implement each
phase of sharding i.e. just pass in a ContainerBroker instance.

The change also avoids any potential for a stale copy of
own_shard_range to be used in _misplaced_objects.

Furthermore, the change simplifies testing. It is no longer necessary

commit_message:
Stop passing own_shard_range to _misplaced_objects

Move toward a consistent interface to the methods that implement each
phase of sharding i.e. just pass in a ContainerBroker instance.

The change also avoids any potential for a stale copy of
own_shard_range to be used in _misplaced_objects.

Furthermore, the change simplifies testing. It is no longer necessary
to create an own shard range instance simply to pass it to
_misplaced_objects() in tests.

There was previously some efficiency gained from fetching a single
instance of own_shard_range which was passed to _misplaced_objects and
used to evaluate the state of the sharding process. This is traded off
for the advantages described above.

Change-Id: I96ec8a06c859d49823ec97314011694eac87cb16

commit_message:
Remove setting of ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL

Adding ETC binaries was a stop gap measure until packages were
available.  With the impending release of bionic that'll be soon :)

Also using the mirror on tarballs.o.o was unreliable so these binaries
are cached in the nodepool images as described in[1].  Having this
setting in d-g makes more work than is needed in the near term.
Removing it does introduce a new failure mode if an etcd version is
used in devstack but not yet cacched in the image.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2018-March/005871.html

Change-Id: I2a6649ae3094ca65aa31798ee9bddf2fcdd49260

subject: Only delete misplaced objects that were moved
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 17:26:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

Before, we read any misplaced objects from a range of the source db,
replicated them, then removed everything in that range from the source
db. Any objects being merged between the read and the removal would be
lost.

With this patch, two safety measures are added:

First, the broker info is sampled before objects are read. The info is
annotated with the db max_row at that moment. Then, when objects are
removed, only rows up to the max row in the sampled broker info are
removed. Any new rows will be retained and dealt with on the next
cycle.  It is possible that new rows were in fact yielded and
replicated, but it is not certain, so they should not be removed. At
worst they will be replicated again on the next cycle and then
removed.

Second, before removing any rows, a check is made that the broker id
has not changed. If it has then no rows are removed.

Change-Id: I923c257996eb1bfd3aa17895616750461b3aee59
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-03-25 11:59:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

worst they will be replicated again on the next cycle and then
removed.

Second, before removing any rows, a check is made that the broker id
has not changed. If it has then no rows are removed.

Also add unit test for ContainerBroker.remove_objects().

Change-Id: I923c257996eb1bfd3aa17895616750461b3aee59
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-03-25 12:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

annotated with the db max_row at that moment. Then, when objects are
removed, only rows up to the max row in the sampled broker info are
removed. Any new rows will be retained and dealt with on the next

commit_message:
Only delete misplaced objects that were moved

Before, we read any misplaced objects from a range of the source db,
replicated them, then removed everything in that range from the source
db. Any objects being merged between the read and the removal would be
lost.

With this patch, two safety measures are added:

First, the broker info is sampled before objects are read. The info is
annotated with the db max_row at that moment. Then, when objects are
removed, only rows up to the max row in the sampled broker info are
removed. Any new rows will be retained and dealt with on the next
cycle.  It is possible that new rows were in fact yielded and
replicated, but it is not certain, so they should not be removed. At
worst they will be replicated again on the next cycle and then
removed.

Second, before removing any rows, a check is made that the broker id
has not changed. If it has then no rows are removed.

Also add unit test for ContainerBroker.remove_objects().

Change-Id: I923c257996eb1bfd3aa17895616750461b3aee59

subject: Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 11:21:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range

Before, when cleaving shard ranges, the sharder created local db's for
each shard range and spawned a thread to replicate them. There was no
check that the replication of each db was successful.

Now, each cleaved db is replicated in turn and cleaving does not
progress until each db has been sufficiently replicated. Replication
is considered sufficient if a quorum of replicas were sync'd. If the
sharding node happens to be one of the cleave db's primaries then that
counts as a sync'd replica.

For example, with a 3 replica container ring, replication is
considered sufficient if the cleaved db was sync'd with at least 2
other nodes, or if the cleaved db is on one of it's primaries and also
sync'd with one other node.

Change-Id: I1653ed69c51c9789e2ef19fae762a96a63139766

commit_message:
Require sufficient replication of each cleaved shard range

Before, when cleaving shard ranges, the sharder created local db's for
each shard range and spawned a thread to replicate them. There was no
check that the replication of each db was successful.

Now, each cleaved db is replicated in turn and cleaving does not
progress until each db has been sufficiently replicated. Replication
is considered sufficient if a quorum of replicas were sync'd. If the
sharding node happens to be one of the cleave db's primaries then that
counts as a sync'd replica.

For example, with a 3 replica container ring, replication is
considered sufficient if the cleaved db was sync'd with at least 2
other nodes, or if the cleaved db is on one of it's primaries and also
sync'd with one other node.

Change-Id: I1653ed69c51c9789e2ef19fae762a96a63139766

subject: Catch Errors When Nova API Microversions Are Not Supported

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-24 23:38:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Catch Errors When Nova API Microversions Are Not Supported

Throughout OpenStack, the eventlet library is used heavily
for threading. In this case, we use spawn_n() from
eventlet which does not return whether the method that was
wrapped with it raised an exception. Exceptions are instead
just printed to stderr. Many deployers are using simple
logging configurations that just log everything to a file.
This poses a problem because spawn_n() does not use standard
Python logging, but rather just prints a stack trace to stderr, like
this: https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/greenpool.py#L93

Any exceptions that get thrown in enventlet.spawn_n() are
not shown in log files that are setup with normal log
configurations that write to files. Deployers who have not been
heavily involved with a lot of upstream development or do not
know the internals of eventlet would think that there are no
errors when tailing their log files which makes debugging
problems extremely difficult. There are a few options
to make error handling better

1. Use spawn() instead of spawn_n(). spawn() returns a greenthread
object that would allow us to see the results of the call. We could
check the results and log a proper exception if we used spawn().
The problem is, this would incur a performance penalty as spawn()
is slower than spawn_n()

2. Expect deployers to write a custom log handler that will redirect
stderr to their log file

3. Use proper exception handling inside of the functions that are called
with spawn_n() so that exceptions we care about get caught and logged
correctly

My patch takes the option 3 approach. If deployers are not using a version of
Nova API on the backend that supports microversions, then the aggregate object
will not return a UUID which will cause an exception to be raised when we go
to associate the segment with the aggregate. This breaks the flow and the
resulting host aggregate will be empty which is useless. On top of that, most
deployers will never know because no errors get logged with Python's standard
logging framework when this happens.

Change-Id: I9c6151ffa90394612e7f81ededd4a309dd8ab7fb

resulting host aggregate will be empty which is useless. On top of that, most
deployers will never know because no errors get logged with Python's standard
logging framework when this happens.

Change-Id: I9c6151ffa90394612e7f81ededd4a309dd8ab7fb

commit_message:
Catch Errors When Nova API Microversions Are Not Supported

Currently, errors related to lack of microversion support are completely
masked because of the way eventlet.spawn_n() works. These changes
improve error handling so that deployers are explicitly notified when
Nova API microversions are not supported. This is useful because without
microversion support, the entire flow will break and hosts will not be
associated with segments properly. Deployers will have no idea why
because errors are not printed to log files setup by the standard Python
logging framework.

Related-Bug: #1759004
Change-Id: I9c6151ffa90394612e7f81ededd4a309dd8ab7fb

commit_message:
Allow all pollsters can be specified when starting ceilometer-polling

For now, the pollsters in ipmi namespaces cannot be specified when
starting ceilometer-polling without --polling-namespaces specified, that
because the ceilometer-polling assume the default namespaces are:
['compute', 'central'], the 'ipmi' doesn't be included.

Change-Id: I8872132f41a7494de7d5226c34e61891cc562a03
Closes-Bug: #1603320

commit_message:
Revert "Create ovs temp directories when using ovs"

This reverts commit 7ba9b763828155ba4ec639b92017061b013a2f5f.

Open vSwitch is creating the /var/run/openvswitch directory with the
correct permissions before the systemd services are started so we
shouldn't have to do that ourselves.

Closes-Bug: #1754139
Change-Id: If351f5562a6c0c6ec7404ee2a827772fed32b858

commit_message:
Set ubuntu-bionic as non-voting on zuul-jobs

This is preventing us from landing code, as since bionic isn't
released yet that is okay since we don't gate any projects.

The bionic issue looks to be around apt cache being stale.

Change-Id: Icfe6b7389f2e91021dca09c5c534448632974e01
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2018-03-19 11:11:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix 'pause' engine command

* Commands going after 'pause' in 'on-XXX' clauses
  were never processed after workflow resume. The
  solution is to introduce a notion of a workflow
  execution backlog where we can save these commands
  in a serialized form so that the engine dispatcher
  could see and process them after resume.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I963b5660daf528d1caf6a785311de4fb272cafd0
Closes-Bug: #1714054
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2018-03-22 07:36:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix 'pause' engine command

* Commands going after 'pause' in 'on-XXX' clauses
  were never processed after workflow resume. The

commit_message:
Fix 'pause' engine command

* Commands going after 'pause' in 'on-XXX' clauses
  were never processed after workflow resume. The
  solution is to introduce a notion of a workflow
  execution backlog where we can save these commands
  in a serialized form so that the engine dispatcher
  could see and process them after resume.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I963b5660daf528d1caf6a785311de4fb272cafd0
Closes-Bug: #1714054

Use hostvars to get ansible_default_ipv6

I think this is missing picking this up from hostvars, so always
assumes ipv4.

commit_message:
Storwize: check flashcopy_rate before mkfcmap

Configure flashcopy_rate in volume type, there is no value
checking before mkfcmap.

This patch adds flashcopy_rate checking before make fcmap.

Change-Id: I7823749bd8add3ce41e4b2862fd0f06dd0fa0888
Closes-Bug:  1753908

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0ef8ed50f55fa905b6090805a3088fc5ab56906c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
deprecate old general configurations

In order to better support the growing list of
supported configurations we need to prune out the
older less tested configurations in src

Configurations required should be documented and
listed in https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553892/
Change-Id: I56fb4113d4615546ae4fb62e729b262fc985d0d1

commit_message:
Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130
(cherry picked from commit c347cd2bf4f3b3f02e41f07edbf7960ff59110cd)

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: Ibc431c82610549171be9f044ac48c4b5f1a50781
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 19:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py'], 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)

subject: Fix integer -> method conversion for python3
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 15:40:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Expose python3 bug when cache_on_issue is False

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because
it is coded to expect division operations to return integers, which
is accurate for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two
integers, which doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth
methods. For example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

You can recreate this by initiating the token validation process
and disabling the CONF.token.cache_on_issue configuration option.

Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa

  1

commit_message:
Fix integer -> method conversion for python3

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because it
is coded to expect integers when dividing numbers, which is accurate
for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two integers, which
doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth methods. For
example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

This commit introduces unit tests to prevent regression and includes
a fix so that the conversion works properly on python3.

Closes-Bug: 1758121
Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa

commit_message:
Switch project neworks.ports to mock

In Python3, map() returns a map object. It is better to ensure to pass
an iterable object when the value is passed to another library.
_construct_parameters in networks/ports/workflows.py is updated.

Change-Id: I471a5620806b0b4e62604cc57dde2485fbdcf242
Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches project that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

commit_message:
Make tags filter match subset rather than exact

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches projects that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

This change makes it so that "tags" filtering will be performed by
matching a subset containing given tags against projects, rather than
exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#filtering-and-searching-by-tags

Co-Authored By: Nicolas Helgeson <nh202b@att.com>

Closes-Bug: #1756190
Change-Id: I632efdf0af2969be0a59dc5928a6c036eeca6051

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 00:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': 'Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425

commit_message:
Correctly set NeutronMl2PluginBase for OVN scenario

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134
(cherry picked from commit e534a7a213294bdf8908addaa3b3da4e070a78dc)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie9af7f8458571e89a91bac8497c3cd8612fdcb35
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Amend the migration paging spec for uuid in server migrations response

During the review of I7e01f95d7173d9217f76e838b3ea71555151ef56
we made the decision to also add the migration uuid to the server
migrations GET responses to be consistent with the os-migrations
change to add the uuid to the response. This change simply amends
the spec to mention that change as well.

Part of blueprint add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list

Change-Id: Icdd598d34748240a3ed9dade561f8f34857adbc3

commit_message:
Don't assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4

Several places assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4 are set, which
may not be true in ipv6 environments like limestone.  Rework several
of the setup and checks to not assume they are there.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556784
Change-Id: I8cbe78bc127652229917d9e7f531a95f4b6fb0f7

subject: Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-28 01:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', '.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0477df2f4275b79380a8a277de38f97884938e3c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove option standalone_network_plugin_ip_version

'standalone_network_plugin_ip_version' option has been
deprecated. This option has been replaced by
'network_plugin_ipv4_enabled' and
'network_plugin_ipv6_enabled' options.

Change-Id: I0251fecddac74578698bcda5d46e44ca16bd8a76

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8596b2a4d38c43cfa18e4dfa0c15990326ecc75c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034

After run manila tempest the share network residue

After run manila tempest with multi-tenancy there have manila share network residue.
This manila share network should be deleted in clear resources.

subject: Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 20:06:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.

This commit adds three new StatsD buckets to the object expirer:

* object-expirer.deferred: times that the object DELETE attempt gets a
  404 or 412 and the expirer decides to retry the deletion later.

* object-expirer.bad_status: times that an unexpected status code was
  received from an object deletion attempt. Currently, this is
  everything except 2xx, 404, 409, and 412.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,
  i.e. the containers in the ".expiring_objects" account.

Hopefully, this will give operators more visibility into what the
object expirer is doing.

Change-Id: I470c721c56c15817316d1042398227694f3f2aa0

commit_message:
Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.

This commit adds three new StatsD buckets to the object expirer:

* object-expirer.deferred: times that the object DELETE attempt gets a
  404 or 412 and the expirer decides to retry the deletion later.

* object-expirer.bad_status: times that an unexpected status code was
  received from an object deletion attempt. Currently, this is
  everything except 2xx, 404, 409, and 412.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,
  i.e. the containers in the ".expiring_objects" account.

Hopefully, this will give operators more visibility into what the
object expirer is doing.

Change-Id: I470c721c56c15817316d1042398227694f3f2aa0

commit_message:
Expose vlan trunking in metadata/configdrive

This proposal aims to expose vlan subinterfaces associatecd with trunk
ports in metadata and configdrive, with which cloud-init (or possibly
glean) can configure the vlan subinterfaces in the guest instances.

Change-Id: I23b4e98e8cdd380f52d18855b9a9d5163756b728

commit_message:
look at correct branch when determining the sdist name

We need to check out each repository to the hash for the latest
release on the branch to check the sdist name because (a) the name may
change over time and (b) the setup.py file may be removed from master
after a project is retired.

Change-Id: Id207d2ee7e2b70ffad562c7912a0543a4b9f9750
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 13:43:39.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py'], 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)

commit_message:
more robustly handle error when we can't determine sdist name

Instead of passing None to the service as the sdist name, report that
situation as an error.

Change-Id: Ib6380d997db780ae324a4df61fdfa7f17e4507c3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

api-ref: Parameter verification for servers.inc (1/3)

This patch verifies query parameters.
Subsequent patches will verify other parameters.

commit_message:
Fix parameter error in image_utils

Ref patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514658/

1. Fix parameter error of method fetch_to_volume_format that
   called in fetch_to_raw and fetch_to_vhd.
2. Add new parameter volume_subformat for fetch_to_vhd to keep
   the same business with [Ref patch].

Change-Id: Id30ffd8a40eca841b5d6461c2f0269a0d9a4d628

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 18:30:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468
(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)

commit_message:
Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468
(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)

commit_message:
Fix post up checksum script

The post up checksum script was being executed by the legacy networking
To ensure we retain the same capabilities the checksum fix script has
been moved into a systemd oneshot service.

Change-Id: I58d393eb8c78a541142a29c5e0678cbd6ec18b65
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
remove zmq tests

At the Rocky PTG the Oslo team decided to once again deprecate and
remove the ZMQ driver. This is the first part of doing that, which
removes the unit tests and extra functional test jobs, which are
failing.

Change-Id: Ia02adf122d2d4ff281e7c9fd3dff8894da241925
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from job definition

Given that the parent is the functional job, which already
includes all the required roles, this is unnecessary and
only serves to slow down the test.

Change-Id: Iadcebc9eca9e279ea647a7a35bff5d00f82489f1

commit_message:
Fix fluentd upgrade tasks during FFU.

The upgrade task doesn't check for the service existence which make
the upgrade fails during ffu.

We're using the set_facts idiom as it persist between steps.

Closes-Bug: #1757985

Change-Id: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770
(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)

* The minimum required Cinder API microversion that Nova
  checks for is 3.44.
* The first TODO about disallowing a volume to be attached to
  the same instance multiple times has been resolved by
  change I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187.

  we added microversion 2.60 for multiattach volume support in nova.
